Fig. 2. Pipeline of data processing. (A) Collecting soccer videos. (B) Tracking and collecting the frame-by-frame positions of players. (C) Mapping positions in different frames to a 2D layer. (D) Detecting formation information from the players position data. Formation detection can be divided into 4 steps: (D1) producing initial role distributions for 10 players, (D2) assigning players to different role distributions in each frame, (D3) iterating over D2 until the convergence of the players’ assignments, and (D4) labeling the detection result to obtain final formations.

Fig. 4. System interface. The system comprises two views, namely, a formation view (A) and a display view (G). Formation view contains a confrontation matrix (B), a narrative timeline (E), and two formation flows (F). Display view contains a pitch (H) and a statistical dashborad (I).
